page.title: 17Local History Knowle Green
page.content:
Repairs to a section of the old Bobbin Mill now owned by Mini-prints revealed that it was a building without foundations and possibly dating from the 17th Century. In former times, Knowle Green had its own "Knocker-up" who summoned labour to the mill in the early hours of the morning.
Half a mile west of Knowle Green is a curious stone incribed by one Radcliffe "to lie here forever" set in the hedgebank of farm approach and known locally as the "Written Stone".
The eastern end of the area close to the Hall's Arms and Newdrop Inn is the site of the Roman Road passing northwards from Ribchester. Its straight course can be painly seen from the motor car layby at Cardwell House.
